Klocwork
Plugin Version @PLUGIN_VERSION@
Revised on July 1, 2015
Klocwork provides source code analysis tools that boost development productivity.
Klocwork's static analysis technology identifies security vulnerabilities and reliability defects, optimize their peer code review process, and enable developers to create more maintainable code.
Klocwork Links
More information can be found at this website.
ElectricFlow Integration to Klocwork
The plugin calls the Klocwork kwinject, kwadmin and kwbuildproject command line and passes the user-provided parameters to perform klocwork task like:
Create, Delete or Load projects
Create a build specification.
Run the integration build analysis. After finishing our postp feature will catch the most common errors and easily detect errors.
Integrated Version
This plugin was developed and tested against version 9.2
Plugin Procedures
IMPORTANT: In the ElectricFlow UI, from the Home page, open the Main Menu, and click Admin > Plugins to open the Plugin Manager.
IMPORTANT: For all parameter descriptions below, required parameters are shown in bold italics.
runKwinject
The runKwinject procedure creates and executes a command line from the parameters you provide in the procedure form.
The main goal of kwinject is to create a build specification for a C/C++ project
Parameter
Description
Klocwork root
Root directory on which Klocwork's files are stored, otherwise default will be assumed.
Kwinject shell script
Absolute path to the script (in case you build with a shell script).
Debug
Displays debug information (This is the command-line '--debug' option).
Extra commands
Commands to be entered when executing the command line.
Output file
Writes the build specification to file. By default, the build specification is written to kwinject.out in the current working directory (This is the command-line '-o' option).
This option cannot be used with the --trace-out option.
Working directory
Directory from which you want to run klocwork.
AdminProject
The AdminProject procedure allows you to create, delete and load projects
Parameter
Description
Klocwork root
Root directory on which Klocwork's files are stored, otherwise default will be assumed.
Kwadmin action
Choose the action for kwadmin to perform. Available options are: Create project, Load project and Delete project
Project name
Name of the project that will be created, deleted or loaded depending on the previous option.
Language
Specify one or more languages of the source code for this project. Valid arguments are c, cxx, csharp and java. Multiple arguments can be specified, separated by a comma (for example language c,java) (This is the command-line '--language' option).
Verbose mode
Displays output information about program execution (This is the command-line '--verbose' option).
Tables directory
Specifies the location where you want to take/store the project's tables.
Working directory
Directory from which you want to run klocwork.
runKwbuildproject
The runKwbuildproject procedure allows you to run the klocwork integration build analysis
Parameter
Description
Klocwork root
Root directory on which Klocwork's files are stored, otherwise default will be assumed.
Verbose mode
Displays output information about program execution (This is the command-line '-v' option).
Force
Run the build even if the tables directory specified with --tables-directory contains data files from the previous run (This is the command-line '-f' option).
License host
Sets License Server host (default: localhost) (This is the command-line '-H=' option).
License Port
Sets the license server port (default: 27000) (This is the command-line '-P=' option).
Tables directory
Specifies the location where you want to take/store the project's tables (This is the command-line '--tables-directory' option).
Extra commands
Commands to be entered when executing the command line.
Working directory
Directory from which you want to run klocwork.
